string-array.name: settings_descriptions
string-array.item: Choose a light or dark base theme for the entire application.
Choose a color scheme for the Now Playing screen and playback controls.
Rearrange the order of the app\'s main pages.
Customize the way cover art is displayed on the Now Playing screen.
Pick whether you want to use the album art fetching service or display embedded art.
Choose the folders that contain your music. Files in other folders will be ignored.
Rescan your music folders to update your music library.
Set how often your want your music folders to be scanned for new files.
Legal jingo about the app and its components.
Spot a bug, have a feature request, or can\'t figure something out? We\'re here to help.

resources.string: Feel free to close the app during this process. Swipe down your notification drawer at any time to check the current progress.

This expiry counter will reset itself when you install an update to the BETA. You\'ll also still get the regular 10 day trial when the final version is released.
You are using the BETA version of ALMusic Music Player. It will expire in
Tap on an album to blacklist it (highlighted) or remove it from the blacklist (unhighlighted).
Tap on an artist to blacklist them (highlighted) or remove them from the blacklist (unhighlighted).
To remove an item from the blacklist, fling it away in either direction.
Tap on a song to blacklist it (highlighted) or remove it from the blacklist (unhighlighted).
Modify blacklisted artists, albums, and songs.
All songs in this album are stored on your Google Play Music account and cannot be added to a local playlist. Try creating a Google Play Music playlist instead.
All songs by this artist are stored on your Google Play Music account and cannot be added to a local playlist. Try creating a Google Play Music playlist instead.
All songs in this genre are stored on your Google Play Music account and cannot be added to a local playlist. Try creating a Google Play Music playlist instead.
This song is stored on your Google Play Music account and cannot be added to a local playlist. Try creating a Google Play Music playlist instead.
Editing this album\'s tags will cause every song in the album to change their tags as well. Are you sure you want to continue?
Editing this artist\'s tags will cause every song by the artist to change their tags as well. Are you sure you want to continue?
Swipe in either direction to change tracks.
Swipe left or right to change tracks. You can also peek at the next or previous track without changing the current track.

Swipe in from the right bezel on any screen to access the list of songs that are currently being played. You can also access playback controls and the player screen from this drawer.
Libraries allow you to group your music into smaller subcollections. Think about them as playlists on steroids. You can manage custom libraries in Settings.\n\nTouch to dismiss.
Drag items in the screens list to rearrange their order.
Pick the default browser to display when the app starts.
You default folder does not exist. Falling back to root.

Are you sure you want to delete this folder? This operation cannot be undone.

Done getting all pinned songs from Google Play Music.

ALMusic doesn\'t support tag editing for songs on Google Play Music, yet. This feature will be added in a future update.

Please restart your playback from the launcher page
Google Play Music is disabled. You can enable it in Settings.

*Google neither supports nor endorses ALMusic Music Player and its use of the Google Play Music service. ALMusic will access your music library using unofficial APIs. Google may choose to change their service at any time and cause this app to lose access to your library. Proceed at your own risk.
ALMusic can stream your Google Play Music library to your device. You must have the official Google Play Music app installed to use this feature.

Do you store your music in the cloud? Tap \'Yes\' to import your library from Google Play. ALMusic will only stream your songs to your device. It will not download them and none of your music on Google Play will be modified.

NOTE: ALMusic will access your music on Google Play through an unofficial API. This means that Google does not support this app and you may lose access to your music from ALMusic at any time . Keep in mind that your actual music on Google Play will always stay intact and that ALMusic will never modify your playlists or music without your permission.
If you are using an HTC device and your volume controls are stuck at max, go to Settings > Equalizer and tap \"Disable\". This is a known issue with the API and is currently being fixed by Google.
doesn\'t seem to be an audio file. Check to make sure that the file extension is set properly.

the next time you play it.

This playlist already exists. Choose another name.
The playlist could not be created.

Feel free to contact the developer through the channels provided in the settings page of the app, your feedback on any parts of the app that you like (or dislike) will be highly appreciated. please be detailed in reporting crashes if there are any.
Choose your preferred album art source. If you\'re not sure, choose the first option. You can change these options later in Settings.
Sorry, you didn\'t win this time. You can still upgrade to the full version though. Tap \"Upgrade\" to continue.
Congratulations! You\'ve won 50% off the upgrade price! Tap \"Upgrade\" to continue.
You must install the official Google Play Music app before you can stream your music with ALMusic. Do you want to install it now?

Have you set up your selected account in the official Google Play Music app? Doing so will enable ALMusic to seamlessly sync your music from the cloud. If you choose not to set up the official Google Play Music app, you will have to manually sync your music every time you update your library.
ALMusic will now build your music library and album art. Feel free to close the app during this process.
Type in a new name for the playlist.
Press and hold the repeat button to open the Repeat Song Range dialog.
Drag the scrubbers to select the part of the song you would like to repeat.

ALMusic needs to rescan your music folders to fully update your music library with the new song tags. Using the app without rescanning may cause stability issues while accessing songs that you just edited. Touch \'Rescan\' to continue.

Your music library needs to be rescanned to display the updated song tags. If you want to edit more tags, you can update after you\'re done editing all your tags. Tap on the \'Rescan Required\' banner at the bottom of your screen once you\'re ready. \n \nTo prevent potential problems, music playback will be disabled until you rescan your library.
You must rescan your music library before you can play music. Tap the banner at the bottom of your screen to rescan right now.
Rotate your device to portrait mode to go back to the previous screen.
Pick how often you want your library to be rescanned for new music. You can always manually rescan from the app too.
Set how often the music/playlist folders should be scanned.
ALMusic will continue scanning for album art in the background. You\'ll be notified once this process is done. To view its progress, swipe down your notification drawer.
Toggle scrobbling and choose your scrobbling app.
Type in a file name for the downloaded song. ALMusic will automatically embed album art and song metadata into the downloaded file.
To add a music folder to your library, check its corresponding checkbox on the left.
Select the folder(s) that contain your music by checking the checkboxes on the left. Tapping on a folder will display the folder\'s contents.
Sign in to Google Play Music
Signing in to Google Play Music.

Share ALMusic Player on Facebook and get 30% off your upgrade price!\n \nJust sign in to Facebook, share ALMusic with your friends using the Facebook Share dialog, and you\'ll instantly get the 30% discount applied to your purchase.
ALMusic is still in its prelaunch stages and might be unstable, this version is meant to get your feedback on the user interface, some features are still experimental and may not work correctly.

Tap here to rescan your library.
Thanks for sharing! Enjoy your 30% off.
Pick the animation to display when you swipe tracks in the player screen.
This track will start from the beginning the next time you play it.

Thanks for using ALMusic Music Player. Your 7 day trial has expired. To remove this time limit, please upgrade to the full version of ALMusic. \n\nIf you have already purchased ALMusic and are still seeing this message, make sure you are signed into the Google account you made the purchase with. Still need help? Give us a yell at ALMusicmusicplayer@gmail.com.

You are currently using the trial version of ALMusic. Upgrading to the full version will remove the trial time limit. \n\nIf you have already purchased ALMusic and are still seeing this message, make sure you are signed into the Google account you made the purchase with. Still need help? Head over to Settings > Contact Us.
Unable to get album art. Check your network connection.
Unable to gain audio focus. Close any other audio apps and try again.
Oops! There was an issue with the purchase. Please try again later.
Unable to reach Google Play. Please try again.

Please wait until other songs have finished being pinned.

string.name: wallet_buy_button_place_holder
string.translation_description: Text on a button that allows a user to make a payment with Google Wallet [CHAR LIMIT=30]

resources.string: Thanks for downloading ALMusic Player. To help you get started with the app, you\'ll be guided through a few initial steps. Swipe left to continue.

On the next dialog, you\'ll be presented with the list of folders that you have access to. Choose the folders that contain the music that you would like to add to your library. Note that audio files in the root directory (/mnt/sdcard) will always be added to your music library.

On the next dialog, choose how often you want your folders to be automatically rescanned. Higher scan frequencies mean that you may need to wait a few moments before you can start using the app. Lower scan frequencies mean that you may need to manually rescan your folders when you add new music.

If you know that you\'ll be frequently changing the music on your device, choose a higher scan frequency on the next dialog. This means that your library will stay as up to date as possible, but you may need to wait a few moments before you can use the app. If your music library won\'t change as often, choose a lower scan frequency.
Remember that you can always manually scan for new music by going to the settings page once the app is set up.

ALMusic will now scan your folders and/or Google Play for audio files and playlists, and build your music library for the first time. This scan will take longer to complete than any subsequent scans, so please be patient and don\'t close the app while it\'s running.
